website_summaries.verdict: The tent to purchase when you want extra sleeping and living space without sacrificing on the construction quality.
pros: 2 doors, 3 windows, and  detachable room divider
Uses a color-coded system of tent poles to make set up easier without needing the instruction manual after awhile
Interior space feels larger than it actually is
Special floor material resists the growth of fungus during long camping trips
cons: The zippers can bind up and sometimes tear with heavy use

customer_reviews.title: This tent is hands down the best tent I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This tent is hands down the best tent I've ever owned! I have been camping most of my life, I'm in my forties, so I've been through a lot of tents. The quality write out of the box is obvious. I set this bad boy up by myself, it took me 25 minutes. Getting the rain fly over was the hardest part, attach to one end before you start pulling over the top. I look forward to many years of my new NTK!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's bigger than I expected and a touch heavier. ...
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than I expected and a touch heavier. Both of those aren't the reason for a loss of a star. The biggest issue we have with the tent is getting the section by the side door to pull tight. That's a pain. It never seems to tighten across the top quite right. Other than that, my son and I put the thing together for the first time in about 45 minutes and got it packed back up (and in the bag) in about the same amount of time. After doing it a couple of times I can see this being a 20-minute process both ways.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Spacious Tent
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice looking tent that seems to be built rather well. Very spacious and the divider was a must. We had two adults and three kids with plenty of room for our beds and clothes. Cons: Takes a bit to set up. My friends had their tents set up before me. We did use a tarp to help protect the bottom of the tent as anyone should. I would recommend this tent to someone who needs a quality tent with a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I have bought so far
customer_reviews.text: Best tent I have bought so far. We are avid campers and a family of six. This tent is terrific in the rain and warm weather, it fits two queen air mattresses and 2 twin air mattresses easily and we still have room for a few tubs and other camping gear. In a severe rain storm we even had a table and chairs inside to play games. We did use a tarp on the bottom for ground cover but we have had no leaks. The only think I do not like is the set-up time and the amount of rain-flies to pull out but, I'd rather be dry and comfy than wet and set-up fast!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I don't have any complaints other then the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I don't have any complaints other then the directions were a little hard to follow. If you want to see some people setting this up, I posted a video on youtube when my husband and one of his friends were setting it up. It took them a little over an hour.
customer_reviews.author: jayme chenoweth

customer_reviews.title: Had one of the poles split after only 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to like this tent, but after using it for the 2nd camping trip one of the main poles started to split. I Know if I try to set it again, it will break and it will have to be replaced. Also, the storage bag is very thin and small. It's hard to fit the tent back into it. One good thing about the tent, is that it seems to keep you dry, but I haven't tried it in a pouring all day rain.
customer_reviews.author: peakaboo

customer_reviews.title: Not good for high winds...
customer_reviews.text: If you are camping in mild wind conditions this tent will work for you. If there is higher than average winds this tent is not going to make it. One of the main poles broke and this tent is no garbage after its second trip. It also takes a lot of time to set it up correctly. That means tying the cover to all the poles. The winds were very high in Vantage WA. Not a fair place to test normal tents but I’ve had other tents out at my annual event that did not break.
customer_reviews.author: Pappashawngo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: First time camping and I easily set this up. It is HUGE!! I can’t get back in the carrying case, but that’s to be expected. Love room divider, windows and 2 doors! Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kimber 1234

customer_reviews.title: Great HUGE tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is HUGE. We fit two twin beds, one queen an XL dog crate and all of our gear and still had room for maybe another twin bed. It's fairly simple to put together. We were the talk of the campsite with this bad boy. My only concern is that it will not fit on some sites. It didn't rain the whole time we were camping, so I will update once we experience rain in it.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tent!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent for a four day camping trip. We are a family of 8 so we needed something big. This tent did not disappoint. It was easy to put up although the instructions concerning the guidewires could be a little clearer. The tent underwent a trial by fire the very first night. Wind gusts up to 30mph, and torrential rain. The only water that got in the tent was when the wind pulled the tent stakes up and the rain came in sideways. We are definitely looking forward to using this tent again, hopefully with less volatile weather. We will be buying more substantial stakes for future camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Happy campers
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, and huge improvement on our easy-up. We probably could have purchased the smaller one, but hey, there's room for more kids. We did one trial run in the back yard before heading out for a camping trip. My husband set it up nearly by himself, probably in about 45 minutes, guy lines and everything. I've taken it down with "help" from the kids, and it took me less than 45 minutes, including getting it all folded up and put away. It stayed warmer than our easy-up, held up to some gusty winds, and was so nice to open up for a mid-day nap. We're happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent if you want room to move around.
customer_reviews.text: We took this out for the first time with a king size air mattress and our two dogs. There was ample room for everyone and the dogs had room to play and hang out. The tent features a very thick floor and we were not worried about the dogs punching holes through it. It held up to the high winds in the Columbia RIver Gorge. The fact that the bag is oversized makes it very manageable to get back in there and cinch down the straps to compact. Overall, we are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Meggy Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Best tent for rain.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent about a week ago and set it up right away. We just so happened to of gotten a huge storm that and; 60 miles an hour winds and heavy downpours 4-5 inches, the storm was so bad that it knocked out power for 2 day for us and 3-4 days for some others. My wife and I went out to investigate the tent afterwards and unbelievably the it was dry. We left it up all weekend and got hit by 3 more storms and it still stayed dry. This is an amazing tent and it’s highly recommended. Note our tent had a spot for power enter the tent.
customer_reviews.author: ICode

customer_reviews.title: Best, hands down, for a large family in rainy areas
customer_reviews.text: I hate rain in my tent. Always. But with four small children, I REALLY hate rain in my tent. After getting washed out in our last tent, we saved up and took the plunge on this one. We couldn't be happier. This is easy to put together, roomy enough for a large family and pets and lots of other luggage, and definitely weather-proof. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: Leakproof, nicely ventilated, spacious.
customer_reviews.text: Camped for 7 nights in northern Alabama in early October. In the day it was around 90F and night was 65F. The tent was well ventilated and spacious. When it rained for a couple of nights everyone else’s tents leaked but ours, however, the tent is very new.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Goetsch

customer_reviews.title: Check with campgrounds about site size.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this rent. No instructions included so it took a while to find from and back. Once set up it was nice...definitely a two person job though. Only used in back yard and a little concerned about size fitting on designated pads at some campgrounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jake1

customer_reviews.title: Love the roominess
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge and very well made. It does not leak at all. Do not set it up in the wind or you will be para-sailing. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Frederick C. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great rain/hail protection
customer_reviews.text: Kept all of our supplies and bedding completely dry in rain and hail. We had a second (different) tent set up at the same time, everything was soaked in the second tent. We were definitely sold on this tent, first time out of the box! All the tie down cords and stakes are burdensome, but since it wasnt windy I only used the 4 necessary to keep the ends upright. I would definitely buy this tent again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Brunnemer

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent
customer_reviews.text: We've camped 3 times so far with this tent and it's been great, lots of room, good features and no rain infiltration. We put down a tarp underneath and carpet inside to protect the floor. Easy for two people to set up and take down. The best advice I ever had was to buy the best and biggest tent I could afford, I did, even though we are a small family, and don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tent doesn't leak!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent for a couple of weeklong trips. The second night we used it, we had a thunderstorm with 40 mph winds. The tent poles were tested and the walls came in a bit but we stayed very dry! The size is absolutely cavernous. We have 4 children and are able to set up air mattresses for everyone. Set up is not bad but there are not really good instructions provided. If you are tired of leaky tents - this one is worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Good n Large
customer_reviews.text: The amount of space in this tent is perfect. I have a family of six and we were able to setup 1 full mattress 2 queens and a twin and still had plenty of room for gear. The windows do not zip from the inside and have to be opened from the outside. If needed there is a divider that can be used for privacy. Setup was easy and is color coded. Very pleased with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent - storage bag is low quality
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, very weatherproof, very big which is great for our large family - wish the bag to hold the tent was stronger. After 2 uses, the zipper on the bag broke totally off and the storage bag ripped. Now I have the job of finding something to store a tent this large which is not going to be fun.
customer_reviews.author: Deana M. MacK

customer_reviews.title: A tent that is Definitely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I researched and researched. This tent blew us away. The weather on Our trip was super rainy. We had 2 inches of standing water all around us. We did not get what all. Not one leak and we had plenty of space for 6 people or more if we needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Whiting

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent!
customer_reviews.text: Took it for the maiden voyage to the adk and it worked great! Plenty of room for the family and dog. Full rainfly kept us dry in the rain, great tent at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and dry!
customer_reviews.text: High quality tent. Used it during decent rain event and stayed dry. Not used in heavy winds so not sure about how it holds up in that condition but seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: this is a great tent we used a 8 man last year with ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great tent we used a 8 man last year with 4 guys with cots and we were packed that is why i went with this one so we would have more room easy to put up
customer_reviews.author: franklin hacecky

customer_reviews.title: Poles do break!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent, but pole broke and the company won’t get back with me for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Tent. Well constructed. Easy to set up. Breathable and fully waterproof. Very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ctmom

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great tent, I feel needs a hole to run ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great tent, I feel needs a hole to run power or propane gas lines inside for heater but solid tent other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I could say that could be better is the set up instruction or lack of them
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the chance to camp with it yet ,but set it up the day I got it.Very roomy and vented well.The only thing I could say that could be better is the set up instruction or lack of them.But with that being said ,it was pretty easy with all the poles color coded with the loops in the tent.Will even go up faster the next time.Rained two days so far and high windy gust over 50MPH. and is dry and standing as it should.Came with all the tent stakes ,but I bought heavier ones for harder ground that I usual camp on.So far love it and will report again after next months fishing trip for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material. Not a strong tent.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap material. Tent started to develop a small rip that quickly grew... Not worth the money you pay. I did enjoy the side but this tent is not built to last..
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: A solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent. Held strong through powerful wind and rain .
customer_reviews.author: Chris Collett

customer_reviews.title: This tent was very easy to setup and was exactly what I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent was very easy to setup and was exactly what I was looking for. Very well made tent, first outing with a few heavy showers and completely dry inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the highest of quality
customer_reviews.text: This tent is big and nice for the most part. the zippers feel very cheap and I will be surprised if they last. secondly the bag the tent comes in is very thin and cheap and tore the second time taking it out. Also for a tent of this cost and supposed quality I was disappointed that it came with cheap metal steaks. The rain fly and floor are thick and I would expect to stay dry in heavy rain. Over all i am only slightly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: eric sprister

product_meta.title: NTK Super Arizona GT up to 12 Person 20.6 by 10.2 by 6.9 Height Foot Sport Family XL Camping Tent 100% Waterproof 2500mm
feature_bullets: THE ULTIMATE FAMILY CAMPING EXPERIENCE! SUPER SPACIOUS 11 to 12 Person (adult/kids) tent, Detachable Room Divider, 2 Doors, 3 Windows Tent Designed for Easy Assembly with color coded poles. Super 6.9 FT height for maximum comfort.

FULL COVERAGE RAINFLY: Double layer 190T polyester laminated with polyurethane 2500 mm water column, partially aluminium, heat-welded PU seam sealed and UV protection, Large covered mesh vents provide even more ventilation. Inner tent: Large D-style doors with mosquito mesh for great views and ventilation. Roomy utility pockets and gear loft for gear storage. Poles included for extended canopy.
FRAME: 100% virgin NANO-FLEX shock corded fiber glass rods with improved diameter and double gold plated ferrules. Aluminium Pin-and-ring system for easy and quick setup.

MOSQUITO MESH: Inner tent fully breathable with generous Ultra-thin polyester NO-SEE-UM style mesh keeps you safe from smallest insects and mosquitos while offering some privacy from side view (when not using the rainfly).

FLOOR MATERIAL AND DESIGN: Heavy duty anti-fungus seamless polyethylene with inner silver coated layer keeps you dry and protected enhanced by the unique element barrier bathtub-style construction (you won't wake up in a puddle!). Security: Meets CPAI-84 flammability requirements. Heavy duty carry bag with compression straps and ID label to personalize your tent.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
